Highlights 
This update addresses security issues for your Windows operating system. 
Improvements 
This security update includes improvements. When you install this KB: 
New! 
This update affects Windows Hello for Business. IT admins can now use mobile device management (MDM) to turn off the prompt that appears when users sign in to an Entra-joined machine. To do this, they can turn on the “ 
DisablePostLogonProvisioning 
” policy setting. After a user signs in, provisioning is off for Windows 10 and Windows 11 devices. 
This update supports daylight saving time (DST) changes in Palestine. To learn more, see  
Interim guidance for DST changes announced by Palestinian Authority for 2024, 2025 
. 
This update supports DST changes in Kazakhstan. To learn more, see  
Interim guidance for Kazakhstan time zone changes 2024 
. 
This update supports DST changes in Samoa. To learn more,  
see Interim guidance for Samoa DST changes 2021 
. 
This update addresses an issue that affects a network resource. You cannot access it from a Remote Desktop session. This occurs when you turn on the Remote Credential Guard feature and the client is Windows 11, version 22H2 or higher. 
This update makes Country and Operator Settings Asset (COSA) profiles up to date for some mobile operators. 
This update addresses an issue that affects Name Service Provider Interface (NSPI) queries. They might fail. If they do,  
lsass.exe 
 stops responding on a domain controller. 
This update addresses an issue that causes your device to shut down after 60 seconds. This occurs when you use a smart card to authenticate on a remote system. 
This update addresses an issue that affects the display of a smart card icon. It does not appear when you sign in. This occurs when there are multiple certificates on the smart card. 
If you installed earlier updates, only the new updates contained in this package will be downloaded and installed on your device. 
For more information about security vulnerabilities, please refer to the  
Security Update Guide 
 website and the  
April 2024 Security Updates 
. 
Windows 11 servicing stack update - 22000.2899 
This update makes quality improvements to the servicing stack, which is the component that installs Windows updates. Servicing stack updates (SSU) ensure that you have a robust and reliable servicing stack so that your devices can receive and install Microsoft updates.

summary:
KB5036894 is a security update released on April 9, 2024, for Windows 11 version 21H2 across all editions. It addresses several security vulnerabilities, including issues related to Windows Hello for Business and Remote Credential Guard, with a notable fix for an access problem with Remote Desktop sessions. This update also introduces improvements in smart card authentication and resolves NSPI query failures that may cause lsass.exe to become unresponsive. The update can be installed via various channels, including Windows Update, and requires that earlier updates be installed first.

**Technical Breakdown**

**Vulnerabilities and Exploits**:
This update addresses high-impact vulnerabilities including issues with Windows Hello for Business and Remote Credential Guard, as well as problems accessing network resources during Remote Desktop sessions. Details are available in the April 2024 Security Updates.

**Windows Hello for Business Configuration**:
To disable the post-logon provisioning prompt for Entra-joined devices, apply the following policy setting via MDM:
```
[Registry Key]
`HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\HelloForBusiness\DisablePostLogonProvisioning` = `1`
```

**Remote Credential Guard Issue**:
To mitigate issues accessing network resources after enabling Remote Credential Guard:
- Ensure client devices are on Windows 11 version 22H2 or higher.
  
**Smart Card Authentication Fix**:
The update resolves an issue where a device shuts down unexpectedly after 60 seconds when using a smart card for remote authentication.

**Error Codes**:
```
[Error Code]
`0x80070520`
```

**Known Issues**:
- **Profile Picture Change Failure**:
  - Symptom: Users may encounter an error when attempting to change their account profile picture.
  - Workaround: Currently under investigation, a resolution will be provided in a future release.

**Installation Process and Prerequisites**:
- Ensure that previous updates are installed to allow the new updates to be applied correctly.
- The update can be installed using the following methods:
  - **Windows Update**: Automatically downloaded and installed.
  - **Windows Update for Business**: Automatically managed per policy.
  - **Microsoft Update Catalog**: Standalone package available for direct download.
  - **WSUS**: Requires configuration of Products and Classifications:
    - Product: Windows 11
    - Classification: Security Updates

To uninstall the LCU, use the following command:
```
[Powershell]
```powershell
DISM /online /remove-package /PackageName:<LCU Package Name>
```
*Note: Running `wusa.exe` with the `/uninstall` switch on the combined package is ineffective as the SSU cannot be removed post-installation.*
